website_summaries.verdict: This mid-priced de-icer offers a lot of features not found in other brands.
pros: Features include an LED light (so you'll know when it's on) and a top-mounted heating element (to keep snow from building up)
cons: Some buyers report durability issues with this option (dies within a few months)

customer_reviews.title: Kept a consistent open hole in the ice during MN winter with temps at -10F (-35F windchill)
customer_reviews.text: Living in Minnesota, it's normal to go below -10F a few times during the winter and remain below 32F for weeks in a row. This De-Icer has done an incredible job. I've checked on my koi a few times with a flashlight at night and I still see them slowly swimming. This was much easier than trying to bring them indoors for the winter. My pond can be buried in snow, but this de-icer continues to keep a consistent size open hole in the water and I appreciate the red light on the top so that I can see it's functioning just fine from within my home. I'd highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Target Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Pond frozen
customer_reviews.text: This summer we put together a pond because we live in Iowa I knew we would need some sort of heater last night temperatures finally dropped low enough in Iowa to see if this gadget would do the job. Guess what... pond is frozen over. I know Amazon has a 3-month return policy but it's kind of hard to test out a product until you get the appropriate weather. I feel ripped off and I probably have dead fish. I'll let the seller explain that one to my kids. Updated review 1/13/2020 Amazon accepted the return. I got a replacement heater. Going on the 2nd year of use. It continues to work and has been very dependable.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: So far so good !
customer_reviews.text: Pond just started to ice over so I set this on top. Be aware if the heater is not in the water it will heat up (light on) and shut off (light off) because the element will shut down after 90 something degrees. I had to melt a hole first to let the heater touch the water, now the light is on and staying on. The hole it made the next day was quite large so I am certain this should do a good job all winter. Time will tell with durability.
customer_reviews.author: Evan E. Wasilewski

customer_reviews.title: Great for our Koi pond
customer_reviews.text: We have approx. 400 gallon koi pond this arrived just prior to our cold front moving thru we had temps that formed ice on the top but this seems so far to have stopped our pond from icing all the way over and the waterfall is still running we're getting down to just 5 degrees tonight so not below zero degrees like some areas but would still normally be iced over by now loving the way this works will do an update a little bit further into the season but so far well worth the dollars spent it is a solid well made product not like some of the more flimsy plastic ones i'm really happy so far
customer_reviews.author: dd

customer_reviews.title: It's working!! Single digit temps!
customer_reviews.text: After returning a defective heater (K&H Pet Products pond de icer - wish I had read the reviews first.....), I bought this one..... it arrived yesterday and is working great.... overnight temps were in the single digits, but there was still a melted hole around the heater in the 4" thick ice this morning! Very happy and relieved to find a product that works. I like the LED indicator light that lets me know it's on, and the long power cord. I recommend this heater.
customer_reviews.author: Aeron M

customer_reviews.title: Product FAIL (Update Jan 2019) Product failed after one season UPDATED
customer_reviews.text: I'm updating my review giving it 2 stars instead of 4. This product failed after one year. My house has plenty of electric and I tried the heater at several outdoor power sources. It tripped breaker at every outlet. I did call the company and they sent me a new one while returning the defective one. We'll see what happens.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Does not last long for it's price.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this de icer in Oct of 2018 and the pump worked great the 1st season and the beginning of this season. Now it is making a really loud noise and seems to be getting louder. It is still keeping a cleared area, for now anyway, but our winter is just getting started and we can't buy a replacement right now. Hopefully this de icer will make this season but then will have to be tossed out since it's way past any return period. Such a waste to spend so much and it only last 1 (hopefully 2) seasons. Next one will be a different model. I would not recommend this model.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Lorimer

customer_reviews.title: Has out lasted all other deicers I’ve had
customer_reviews.text: Has out lasted all other deicers I’ve had. Just as described. Fast shipping. Excellent product great value. Would definitely recommend. *** Update, this is second season & still going strong in MN winter. I use in my koi pond & with extreme weather(blizzard) can get froze over. I bought this Laguna as a backup to the API 1500w Floating De-Icer. The API is for Extreme cold but draws a lot of power & they don’t last long. I have gone through 3 API’s since I have had this Laguna.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: That little red light on top makes all the difference!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this pond heater. I have had many others over the years. Sometimes my pervious ones would trip the breaker and I would not know about it until the ice froze in all around them. My reset button is next to the pond and I would have to trudge out through the ice and snow to reset the circuit breaker. This one has not tripped the breaker once so far. But, the greatest thing is that there is a little red indicator light on top which I can see from the house. If the unit is working the light is on! Brilliant!
customer_reviews.author: Martin  S

customer_reviews.title: Keeps My Koi Alive All Winter
customer_reviews.text: Has worked very well. In NH we had the one of the coldest winters on record this year and my pond did not completely freeze. This is the second winter it has been ran continuously with no issues. As you can see from the photo, my pond is a decent size. It is probably 18 ft by 9 ft. When it's -15 degrees out the pond partially freezes but not within a few feet of the heater. I bought this heater to keep my koi from dying and it has done the job. They have survived the last two winters. I also have two small bubblers hooked up to pump oxygen into the water and keep the water moving.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Henkes

customer_reviews.title: Updated: With failed after one year. (WAS: Like the LED)
customer_reviews.text: The unit arrived as described. The LED on top is good assurance that power is applied. I can't tell if it's working because it hasn't been cold enough to freeze the pond. :-) Update: A year later, I put the deicer back in the pond. I had removed it for summer. It worked for the first month, but now, when it's really cold and I need it most, the unit has failed. Now I'm scrambling to find a replacement. :-(
customer_reviews.author: Brian Castelli

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't shut off...  Electric Bill thru the roof...
customer_reviews.text: I got this a month ago and my electric bill is $30 higher. I've spent more for the heater and the electric than I have for fish (and it's only December...) The unit is supposed to have a thermostat that causes it to shut off when there is no danger of freezing water, but on 50 degree days the unit is still on. I have started just unplugging the unit on warmer days. I give it two stars because it keeps the pond thawed...
customer_reviews.author: G. Dave Post

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't Be Happier
customer_reviews.text: Our small (300 g.) pond froze solid during a recent deep freeze. The ice eventually got to be several inches thick and there was a danger of expansion damaging the downhill wall in our flowerbed. Using the hot pot method of melting a hole in the ice I made a large enough opening to place the Laguna heater in the center of the pond.Two days later all of hte ice was gone and the pond has been ice free since then. I wish I had bought this product years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Koch

customer_reviews.title: Works good at 10 degrees F
customer_reviews.text: My pond freezes solid in north Idaho It’s cement about 10 feet long 4-5 wide and maybe 2 feet deep at low spot It’s fed with natural spring all summer and my frogs plus always die So far this heater is keeping a couple feet circle ice free and temps have been 10F at night I see a gold fish my kids added this summer In the ice free area The light on top tells me it’s cycling good
customer_reviews.author: LEW

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the extra money!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the farm innovators pond heaters for years but after having to replace them every 2-3years, I thought I would try a different brand. This lasted less than 2 full seasons and cost almost twice as much! The only thing I really liked was the little red light on top showing the unit working. The FI one doesn't have that and this unit has a longer cord than the FI heater but that is not enough for me to want to buy a new heater every season @ $70.
customer_reviews.author: Jan G.

customer_reviews.title: Fish are happy  -- not anymore
customer_reviews.text: So far, have had heater a couple months. So far, fish are happy and feeling the heat. We can tell when it is very cold out as we will see the fish gathered around the heater. The temp gauge that we purchased along with the heater has been reading correctly. So far so good. Purchased 9-30-18. On 2-1-19 no longer working. Removed from pond. Underside is totally rusted and tripped our bracer. Had to rush out and find something local as our temp was going down to 0 the next evening. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sharaku

customer_reviews.title: Product is working well, shipping was sub-par
customer_reviews.text: It is working well to keep part of my pond de-iced. Nice to have light on top so I know the unit is on. Fish love it. Not happy with Amazon's idea of shipping. Pictures show it was left in its original thin box and arrived open and damaged. Thankfully unit seemed fine. It was slightly taped by Amazon and a shipping sticker was slapped on it. Not happy with that piece at all! Do better Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Sondra

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 2 months!
customer_reviews.text: This de-icer worked perfectly for 2 months on my small pond- keeping a small area open just as it was designed to do. Yesterday it was off and the GFCI outlet had been thrown. As I have another device also plugged into this outlet, I have found that to be working properly, but when the pond de-icer is plugged in, the circuit disconnects, so the problem is in the de-icer. The metal part of the underside is somewhat corroded which is surprising after only 2 months use. Perhaps that indicates where the problem is. Contacting Laguna via phone didn't work, so trying email. I can't recommend this unit at this point. $80 for 2 months is not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: sepdvm

customer_reviews.title: I liked so many things about this but...
customer_reviews.text: Have purchased these several times. I liked that I could see it was 'on' from a distance via the red light on top keeping my very small bathtub-sized pond free of ice in Ohio winters. Very long cord was a plus also. I only got 1 or maybe 2 winters out of each as they would somehow fill with water and sink an short out. Think it should have lasted longer. Rather bummed.
customer_reviews.author: Gary F. Galletta

customer_reviews.title: Our Goldfish love their own new "Jacuzzi/Fire Pit".
customer_reviews.text: Keeps much of our goldfish pond ice-free. The goldfish seem to enjoy snuggling around the unit like it's their own little Jacuzzi or Fire Pit. I really like that there is a highly visible red light that shows your pond heater is working and hasn't tripped the electrical outlet's circuit breaker. Have only had it for a month so I'm hoping it works for several years.
customer_reviews.author: R. Sylvia

customer_reviews.title: Wow!! It Works!!
customer_reviews.text: We live in Central New Jersey where the average temp for winter is around the freezing temp (32 degrees). We bought this to put into our 65 gallon pond outside to keep our Gold Fish going. So far so good. Every time they see me every other day to feed them, there down at the bottom swimming. They like to hover under the heater which tells me it's all good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lasted one year! Junk!!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great last winter. I stored it in a water tight shed over the summer and just plugged it in today to prep for cold weather and the heater is fried. Pops the breaker immediately. For what I paid it they should offer more than a one year warranty. Keep shopping unless you want to buy a heater annually.
customer_reviews.author: Jason S

customer_reviews.title: Didn't even last one warm winter!
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine at first then corroded on bottom? Looked like bottom coating came off? Toppled over, would no longer float upright, tripped circuit breaker. Tried to unplug, plug back in and it tripped the breaker repeatedly. Used in small in ground hard plastic form pond. Will try to see if there's a warranty?
customer_reviews.author: Natalia A. Kalianna

customer_reviews.title: We had a couple freezing nights already and I plugged it in and the water had gotten pretty warm by morning
customer_reviews.text: The Laguna power heated de-icer works very well. In fact a little too well! I'm afraid it may be too much for my little 50 gal. water garden. We had a couple freezing nights already and I plugged it in and the water had gotten pretty warm by morning. I'm going to keep it but maybe just unplug it during the day until deep winter comes in.
customer_reviews.author: B J Smoker

customer_reviews.title: 2nd year and going strong still
customer_reviews.text: Just finished up with my 2nd sinter using mine. Still worked like a charm, and we had a really cold winter where I am at. Also isn't a killer on the electric bill. Bought a stock tank deicer to use in my 2nd pond this winter as it was much cheaper. Boy was I surprised when I got my next electic bill.
customer_reviews.author: Tami Yeutter

customer_reviews.title: Laguna DeIcer for Ponds
customer_reviews.text: I have a small pond, 5 to 600 gallon out in the backyard. Purchased this heater when my old heater died. It did keep a small opening in the pond even when the wind chill was 30 below. We have had tons of snow and below zero temps frequently this winter and this pond heater did work. I should say that we keep the pump running all winter so I don't know if that helped. The little light on the top is nice because you don't have to wonder if the heater is still working. If this lasts at least 2 winters will replace with the same. Other pond heaters we have purchased usually one last one winter.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra L.

customer_reviews.title: Badly pitted, rusted, and corroded
customer_reviews.text: Heater worked well all winter. After the first season, the bottom is badly pitted, rusted, and corroded. Not sure it will last another season. Cheap metal bottom that should have been rust proof. Surprised that this was sold by an otherwise top company.
customer_reviews.author: Forty Love

customer_reviews.title: De-Icer working as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through a half dozen other brands, and they all failed within first winter. Fingers crossed on this one, but too soon to tell, I do like the red light that lets me know it's working.
customer_reviews.author: The SOAP Dragon

customer_reviews.title: Creates a stable survival hole
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure glad I bought this pond heater prior to this 2016/2017 record cold winter in Portland Oregon. The heater creates a 20 inch opening in a sheet of ice that covers our 700 gallon waterfall pond, even during 18°F weather (cold for this area). All 6 goldfish have survived. I often see them hanging out by the heater like it is the office cooler at work.
customer_reviews.author: G.Millard

customer_reviews.title: Kept a hole open in the pond ice even in sub-zero weather
customer_reviews.text: We had a few really wicked cold days with windchills in the -20s and it kept the pond from freezing over so my fish surrivived the winter. It does use quite a bit of power so my electric bill was higher when in use, but it did what I needed it to do so I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonianMichelle

customer_reviews.title: Pond De-Icer
customer_reviews.text: The item is just as described by seller, and in great condition. It was easy to set up, plugged it in, little red light came on. As for how good it works, I can't really say yet, no ice or snow yet.
customer_reviews.author: Bir66

customer_reviews.title: Works, don't put between waterfall and skimmer
customer_reviews.text: I thought it wasn't keeping a hole in the ice, but I think that was because I put it between my waterfall and skimmer, where it was in a constant flow of water. This didn't let it create an area of warm water around itself. Now that it's out of the flow it's working.
customer_reviews.author: Radovan

customer_reviews.title: Durable, works great
customer_reviews.text: Ordered as an extra for the polar vortex last year and it handled the job perfectly Even after my other older heater (different brand) gave out this heater kept working and doing the job
customer_reviews.author: Chris M

customer_reviews.title: Don’t trust this product!!!
customer_reviews.text: I woke up this morning and THIS HORRIBLE product had quit working and 2 of my Koi fish were DEAD stuck under ice. I am heartbroken. This product couldn’t even last one winter....and it’s only JANUARY!
customer_reviews.author: MiMi

customer_reviews.title: Safe duraable de icer for ponds
customer_reviews.text: I already have one and works great. I just purchased a second one. Now I have one at both ends of the pond. I feel secure this way in the event of a big snow storm or ice storm.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Mast

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: What I really like about this product is the fact that there is a red light showing that it is working. When its freezing out I can look out my second floor window and see the red light indicating it is working. My pond has stayed open and not frozen over because of the de-icer.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne A. Watkinson

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 2 months
customer_reviews.text: We bought this heater on November 10th and it stopped working over the last few days. We have only had a few really cold days, nothing less than 20 degrees, and it is already broke. I was expecting to get at least 1 season out of it but it looks like we need to find something different to keep our smaller Koi pond from freezing. It definitely should have lasted more than 2 months in a firly moderate winter we are having. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: M. Yoas

customer_reviews.title: Mine never seems to turn off.  Even on a 50* day
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if I have a defective unit. LaGuna has a great warranty. I need to contact them. Nice heavy unit with he 15 watts of heat on top makes all the difference.
customer_reviews.author: lotust

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The best winter koi pond heater that I have found.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Lantzer

customer_reviews.title: Works well in snow
customer_reviews.text: My 1st heater (same type and mfgr) lasted 4 years and worked well. Unlike the donut shaped heaters it does not get covered and lost after a heavy snowfall.
customer_reviews.author: Gary J. Banuk

customer_reviews.title: Power heater
customer_reviews.text: So far this heater has held up well. Been a light winter so far in the North East 2019 but this has kept the pond open. I like that it has an indicator light on top so you know it's working. Pond size is about 1000 gallons
customer_reviews.author: Corry

customer_reviews.title: Great price, but doesn't work very long.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my in-laws to help with their koi pond. This thing was used a total of 7 times and just stopped working in the middle of the night. Have not been able to get it to turn on for a few days now. The last unit they had last 6 years, but this one didn't even last for 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Navarro

customer_reviews.title: Working well
customer_reviews.text: I’ve gone through several pond heaters over the years and this is my latest attempt to keep my Koi alive through the winter. Most that I’ve used only kept a small hole open while this one has a 6’x6’ opening, which shows its putting off a good amount of heat. I also like the indicator light on top, letting me know it’s on. I can’t speak to the longevity yet as I’ve only had it a couple weeks.
customer_reviews.author: S. Fairless

customer_reviews.title: Worked then stopped working, light is faint and barely ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked then stopped working, light is faint and barely there and so is the heat! Pond ended up freezing over killing $400 worth of koi fish very upset!
customer_reviews.author: Shopaholic

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this product
customer_reviews.text: Worked for 1 month and quit, currently frozen SOLID in ice in the pond. I do not recommend this product and warn you against purchasing a waste of money! Working on returning it with the manufacturer who is mildly helpful at best. Customer must pay for return shipping AND won't send a replacement until received. Unfortunately prob can't send back until spring since it's in a foot of ice. Terrible product
customer_reviews.author: Troy Wiesenberger

customer_reviews.title: Loved it when it did work
customer_reviews.text: It worked good last winter, but stopped working before winter was over. Less then a year. When can I expect a replacement
customer_reviews.author: Renee Wilkins

customer_reviews.title: Works fine even to 15 below with snow
customer_reviews.text: Its the only one I use ! I have a spare on the shelf. Lasts 3-4 yrs on average. 3000 gal pond in Toledo ohio . Works fine even to 15 below with snow. Keeps the hole open to breathe .. Marty from Toledo OHIO
customer_reviews.author: ellazie

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have been through many pond heaters this by far is the best I have owned. I have 300 gallon patio pond and all winter I dident have to clear any ice. I hope to make it a second season with this one
customer_reviews.author: Charles Kleinschmidt

customer_reviews.title: Used for one full winter.
customer_reviews.text: Kept the pond vented. In NJ winter, the 3" around the unit was kept free of ice, enough to let gasses escape. We might add a second.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn H. Cole

customer_reviews.title: Quit after five months
customer_reviews.text: Installed in pond. Tested it ok. Turned it off for the summer. Turned back on going into autumn and it tripped the GFI. Cannot get hold of the seller and cannot return it.
customer_reviews.author: UKMerlin

customer_reviews.title: does the job
customer_reviews.text: does what it suppose to do. four snow storm already passed and made sure the pond did not freeze over.Now I have to see if it last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: vee

customer_reviews.title: Good heater but wished it would last a few more years.
customer_reviews.text: It's working great. I bought one two or three years ago. This is actually my third one.I just wish it would last a little longer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fish still alive and its keeping our pond from freezimg over!
customer_reviews.text: Still going strong this winter here in Colorado. Fish are still alive and happy! Waterfalls are still getting oxygen to the fish and ~1,400 gallon pond kept from completely freezing over due to the effectiveness of this heater!
customer_reviews.author: Sola Scriptura

customer_reviews.title: Packaging was poor and box was damaged when it arrived
customer_reviews.text: The Laguna pond heater does not float level, one side is underwater while the other is above water. There is no weight to cause it to sit this way. The box was damaged when it arrived and I'm not at all sure it works.
customer_reviews.author: Emily McGrath

customer_reviews.title: Great heater.  Works as promised.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Indicator light lets me know everything is ok. Just replaced with the same model after 4 years of continuous use through the winter. I believe I damaged the cord and It would not work without tripping the gfi breaker. Best unit I have found and did not consider other products. Will replace again if need be...
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Keeps a nice hole in the ice. I really like how there is a light on top so you know it is on.
customer_reviews.author: MT business

customer_reviews.title: Happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: Had such a mild Winter that I don't know how much ice it would have kept open but I know the fish stayed huddled around it.
customer_reviews.author: Norene Greer

customer_reviews.title: Effective Pond De-Icer
customer_reviews.text: Kept a large ice-free circular opening in pond surface when rest of pond froze over. The red On light on top gave assurance that the de-icer was installed and was working.
customer_reviews.author: eileen h

customer_reviews.title: didn't last and made water too warm
customer_reviews.text: this lasted less than 2 years and had to keep it on a timer because on its own it would warm the water up too much. had to keep readjusting for the right # of hours to run. and then it stopped working altogether.
customer_reviews.author: powrtoy

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Working perfectly so far. First one I bought died after 2 months(other brand). This one is working exceptionally well inspite of all the blasted snow storms and fridged temps we're getting here in CT. This one turns on and off automatically and has a built in indicator light on top to let you know when it's heating. Hopefully this one will last so It can be used for several seasons.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Churchill

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. The one that we had before to hear our pond was the green floating one. It worked for one year. Piece of junk. This one seems like it is better made and will hopefully last longer.
customer_reviews.author: KandK

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this last year and it worked great In the winter and had no dead lost , just took it out for this years use.
customer_reviews.author: IAN  ODLE

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: This pond de-icer worked for about a month, then, one day, the light was out and the unit ceased to work. If you’d like a disposable heater with an approximate 1-month lifespan, this is the unit for you. If you love your pond fish, DO NOT purchase this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Best heater I have ever had
customer_reviews.text: Works. Love the red light so I know it's on. ALso nicely self contained.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey

customer_reviews.title: Pond stays unfrozen in center in frigid temp.
customer_reviews.text: It’s doing it’s job even In the negative temps we are experiencing right now in Cincinnati!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This pond heater worked great for our pond. It arrived fast and was well packaged. It has a long power cord and will reach from the deep end of our pond to the electrical outlet, which is about 8 feet and with cord to spare. I turns off when the water warms up so that it will not over heat either the unit or the pond. I highly recommend this heater.
customer_reviews.author: dmally

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Was able to melt through ice formed after 10 days of teens and single digit tempatures after lower powered de-icer froze in place
customer_reviews.author: Steven Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit just in time for the minus 0 temps this winter and it does exactly what it is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: works at 26 below!!!
customer_reviews.text: received first on DOA,got the second one and it works flawlessly
customer_reviews.author: gust b.

customer_reviews.title: Great for a small pond!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! I've only had it in my small pond for a week but it's working. We've had a foot of snow and freezing temperatures and the pond did not completely freeze.
customer_reviews.author: klc408

customer_reviews.title: Hoping for a More Perfect World...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second unit. Last one lasted for three years. Works well and regulates itself. Wish it would shut off at about 38. Ponds work best in the winter when the pond is mostly iced over with only a small hold for the exchange of gasses around the heater. This keeps the fish safe, warm, and happy.
customer_reviews.author: Sly

customer_reviews.title: Last 4 months in a mild winter
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this de-icer in November and it seemed to work fine for most of the Winter. Then all of a sudden it sank to the bottom of my pond having completely filled with water. It does not seem to work any longer. What gives!?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I trust this brand. My last one lasted for ...
customer_reviews.text: I trust this brand. My last one lasted for 10 years. One important feature is the light do you know it's on and working g.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Sayers

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great keeos a pretty big spot deiced on the pond.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Honeycutt

customer_reviews.title: no issues so far and has been running constantly for ...
customer_reviews.text: no issues so far and has been running constantly for 2 months
customer_reviews.author: Joe B

customer_reviews.title: My fishies are happy
customer_reviews.text: I see a big smile on my fish's faces, there happy again. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: John Oskierko

customer_reviews.title: Worked for my koi pond! I have a 6000 ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked for my koi pond! I have a 6000 gallon pond that was completely frozen over for a week and this deicer kept a hole open and my fish survived! I bought another one for a back up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked for three years
customer_reviews.text: Bought this unit in 2016. Get the pond ice free for 3 years , then it died. But it for only $55 back then it is now 80. I'll have to look for an alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Harlan Penn

customer_reviews.title: I'll give it a five next year. (:-))
customer_reviews.text: So far very happy with product. Outlasting the fancy Aquascape one. Hope it lasts for next year.
customer_reviews.author: Frank S.

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: If I was able to give this product a zero I would have. I purchased this heater in October 2018 and it stopped working in December 2018. I woke up one morning, the pond had started to freeze, the light was off and several fish had died. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Emilee

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Keeps our pond open in the negative degree MN winters!
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Kept my pumps running and water moving in one week of below freezing temperatures.
customer_reviews.author: Gerhardt

customer_reviews.title: Quit after 68 days Hope my fish live, just ...
customer_reviews.text: Quit after 68 days Hope my fish live , just sent back today. It is 20 degrees here
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Used for the very first time, for my pond I live in Westchester County N.Y. didn't lose a single fish first time ever
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: NEED AN ELECTRICIAN TO USE THIS
customer_reviews.text: Not happy......can't just plug it in. Wish I could return but past return date.
customer_reviews.author: Monya Pfizenmayer

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised in Wisconsin. Got thru this years ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised in Wisconsin. Got thru this years november polar vortex. I had been using a 1250 watt heat. I will follow up in the spring to let everyone know if I saved on electricity
customer_reviews.author: Steve S.

customer_reviews.title: The red light is great
customer_reviews.text: It is very reassuring when you can see the red glow of the heater light to know that the heater is still working so you don't have to go outside to check it out.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bartlett

customer_reviews.title: It seems to be doing the trick. We have ...
customer_reviews.text: It seems to be doing the trick. We have had lot's of freezing days but the pond is staying clear of ice where the heater is.
customer_reviews.author: Wyatt Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Keeps a big area open for the fish to get air. They also line up by it for heat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keep Your Fish Warm
customer_reviews.text: Great product and my pond fish just love it (last winter).
customer_reviews.author: Robert A Hughes

customer_reviews.title: It worked all winter
customer_reviews.text: It worked! That’s all that matters. I live in north central Indiana and my pond is still alive (plants and fish), even with those 2 weeks or so of brutal temperatures. It’s still on, and as you can see, the fish are hanging out near it for warmth.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Very effective
customer_reviews.text: To keep it short and simple, this thing is the reason my goldfish survived a winter in the pond for the first time EVER. All my previous solutions failed.
customer_reviews.author: Gretel Goodwitch

customer_reviews.title: Great pond heater
customer_reviews.text: Use this in my Pennsylvania outdoor pond with very cold winters. Works well in keeping an opening in the ice. The light on top tells you it's working. My previous model didn't have this light so I find this very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Maryellen Walter

customer_reviews.title: Not working after less than two months
customer_reviews.text: Not happy. Heater blew the GFI. Pond frozen. Have had this heater less than two months.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Harper

customer_reviews.title: great product, went to this instead of using the ...
customer_reviews.text: great product,went to this instead of using the allied precision joke.
customer_reviews.author: ted thorne

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Have had it a month and it is ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Have had it a month and it is doing the job. Winter is not over, so the jury is still out on this item.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Linborg

customer_reviews.title: Replaced once.  Seems to work fine.
customer_reviews.text: Revised review; 1st devise didn’t work. Ordered replacement. It’s been over a year and the de over continues to function.
customer_reviews.author: K. F.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Turns on and off as needed to keep pond open. fish are not able to get into it .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good heater
customer_reviews.text: I owned this heater before it just wore out from years of use. fairly cheap to run .I would recommend to any one
customer_reviews.author: stephen s.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I live in Minnesota and it is -20 here. It keeps a small hole open even at that temperature. I have only used it a month, but so far it is great.
customer_reviews.author: DH

product_meta.title: Laguna PowerHeat Heated De-Icer for Ponds - 315W
product_meta.description: The Laguna PowerHeat De-Icer is for ponds whose temperatures are down to 20 degrees Fahrenheit. The De-Icer is equipped with a 15-watt top-mounted heating element that melts snow on contact, keeping the unit free from snowy build-up. The PowerHeat De-Icer is not meant to heat your pond, but only to aid in gas exchange.
feature_bullets: De-Icer for ponds whose temperatures are down to 20 degrees Fahrenheit
Highly-visible LED pilot light that indicates when unit is on
Integrated thermostat shuts off the De-Icer when it overheats, protecting internal components from damage
315 watts. 7 meter (22 feet) electrical cord with grounded plug
Aids in gas exchange by keeping ice from forming around heater
